conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time graph and calculate the displacement of the particle.
Graph shows velocity in m/s on the y-axis and time in seconds on the x-axis.
To find if the particle returns to its starting point, calculate the total displacement over the 3-second interval.
Displacement equals the area under the velocity-time curve.
Areas above the x-axis represent positive displacement, while areas below represent negative displacement.
From t = 0s to t = 1s: v = 2 m/s (constant).
From t = 1s to t = 2s: v decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s.
From t = 2s to t = 3s: v decreases linearly from 0 m/s to -2 m/s.
Total displacement = 2 m + 0.5 m + (-0.5 m) = 2 m.
Since total displacement is 2 meters, the particle has not returned to its starting point.
Final answer: No, the particle has not returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark.
